fields.summary: Bitbucket pull request page in usable on smartphone

fields.description:
When using secured environment variables in Bitbucket Pipelines, if you set a variable to a value that is outputted to a known value in the build log, you can infer the secured value.

Apparently the log output is secured through a find and replace of the secured variables value. This naive approach can lead to information leaking when the value is the same as some other known string, like the organization name for example.

If you have  {{SECURED_VARIABLE=myorganization}} and your organization is called {{myorganization}}, this will lead to the following output in the build log:

{code}
#!shell

+ umask 000

+ GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone --branch="test" --depth 50 https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/$SECURED_VARIABLE/project.git $BUILD_DIR ; git reset --hard <hash> ; git remote set-url origin git@bitbucket.org:$SECURED_VARIABLE/project.git
Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'...
HEAD is now at <hash> <message>.

+ chmod 777 $BUILD_DIR
{code}

Since the organization name is a known value, you can infer that {{$SECURED_VARIABLE}} is {{myorganization}}.

While there's no 100% safe way to do this since a lot of the output can be generated by the user, it's possible to omit those substitutions in places where the output is 100% generated by Atllassian, such as the repository checkout stage, before the user script even begins.
fields.summary: Secured variables indirectly leak in logs

fields.description: Hello, we use Gifs for our pull requests to demonstrate how the UI works to our pull request reviewers. Previously this used to be a 2MB limit which was small but we were able to work with, now it's a 1MB limit which makes creating any kind of quality gif to upload impossible. Can you please restore this to 2MBs?
fields.summary: 1mb Image Upload Restrictive for Gifs

We need your guidance to isolate this

steps to regenerate the issue:-

# Clone the bitbucket repo to local machine.
# Make some modifications to any of the files
# Git add , git commit and git push will directly merge the changes back to any branch given with below information.

Counting objects: 4, done.

Delta compression using up to 4 threads.

Writing objects: 100% (4/4), 915 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.

Total 4 (delta 2), reused 0 (delta 0)

remote:

To git@bitbucket.org:cloudleaf/build-scripts.git

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Windows 10.
# Firefox, 59.0.2.
# Go to: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-org-webhook-not-working-at-all-not-sending-requests/qaq-p/776864
# Click on Log in.

Expected result:

# Be logged in.

Actual result:

# Get redirected to: https://saml-aid.atlassian.com/simplesaml/saml2/idp/SSOService.php (and a huge hash after .php, in the URL)
# Get sent to: https://id.atlassian.com/openid/v2/op, which wants me to download a "op" file.
# op file contents:

{code:<XRDS}
       <XRD xmlns="xri://$xrd*($v*2.0)">
         <Service>
           <Type>http://specs.openid.net/auth/2.0/server</Type>           <URI>https://id.atlassian.com/openid/v2/op</URI>
         </Service>
       </XRD>
     </XRDS> ```

I know the issue is not in the correct place, but I don't know where to place it. It's an Atlassian Cloud Single Sign On Issue. The Atlassian Community site should recognize my log in (I'm already logged in to Bitbucket, Jira and Confluence, all cloud) and it should automatically log me in or actually log me in correctly when I do it manually. 

I also don't have "Assign" permission on any project here: https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/

In case you're wondering how I am able to comment there, I have to go to Bitbucket -> Support -> Community every time, and in that case it somehow keeps the log in so I don't have to log in again.
{code}
fields.summary: Atlassian Community Single Sign On broken

fields.description: If you open the existing branch-permission for editing, click "cancel", and then click on the create new branch-permission button, the modal window opens and disappears immediately.
fields.summary: The modal branch-permissions window is displayed and immediately disappears.

fields.description:
I have this python snippet inside one of my markdown pages:

{code}
# some comment

... Some code
{code}

When I create a table of contents with the <<toc >> tag it shows the actual headings in my file but also shows the comment in my code snippet. This is really annoying as you end up with a table of contents that looks like this:

* Heading

** SubHeading
* some comment
fields.summary: Hash (#) character inside a code block gets picked up by <<toc >> as a title

fields.description:
I'm trying to run two steps in parallel and one of those steps has an {{artifacts}} definition. The pipeline crash because it assumes that the {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} files is not valid. Here's the file:

{code}
#!yml

image: node:8.11.1

pipelines:

  tags:                         
    v*.*.*:  
      - parallel:
        - step:
            image: browserless/chrome
            caches:
              - node
            script:
              - export NODE_ENV=test
              - npm install
              - npm run test-ci
              
        - step:
            script:
              - npm run build
            artifacts:
              - dist/**

      - step:
          name: Deploy to staging
          deployment: staging
          caches:
            - node
          script:
            - npm run deploy
{code}

It would be great to have this option .
fields.summary: Artifacts in a step defined in a parallel section

fields.description:
If I have branch A with 1 commit and Branch B based on Branch A with 1 more commit, and create a PR for Branch A to Branch C and another PR for Branch B to Branch C bitbucket creates 2 PR where the first, PR BCLOUD-1, has 1 commit and the 2nd, PR BCLOUD-2, has 2 commits (incl. the one in the other PR).

If PR BCLOUD-1 gets merged, the PR BCLOUD-2 gets updated to remove the commit that was merged from PR BCLOUD-1, and end up having a single commit, the one that was specific to PR BCLOUD-2.

This is ok, but I would like a more advance behavior, where BitBucket would recognize that the PR BCLOUD-2 depends on PR BCLOUD-1 and do not display the first commit as part of PR BCLOUD-2.  That PR BCLOUD-2 can only gets merged successfully if PR BCLOUD-1 is merged first (or deleted).

This would allow a better workflow where changes are stacked together to be merged into the same branch.
fields.summary: Pull request dependencies

fields.description:
I've noticed that Pipelines runs automatically every time that a branch is moved (fast-forward) to a more recent commit.

In our way of working, usually developers use dev branches in which Pipelines already runs every time a commit is pushed. Then all dev branches are merged into master and then all dev branches are fast-forwarded to the latest state of master.

In this last step, since Pipelines already run on the most recent commit (pushed to master branch), I think it's redundant that it runs again only because the dev branches are fast-forwarded and pushed to that same commit.

It would be nice to be able to configure Pipelines to avoid running on a commit in which it already ran before.
fields.summary: Configuration to avoid running several times on the same commit

fields.description:
It would be a great feature if we could navigate through the code with a "tree view" on the page. It is a common UX used for most IDEs (eclipse, for instance).

Currently, if I'm navigating the source code and find a reference to another file, I need to go back in browser history, so I can see the root path of the repo and then select the file I want.

With this feature, the user would be able to see the repo structure and the content of one file at the same time.
fields.summary: Tree View for Souce Code Navigator

fields.description:
Hi

Sometimes working with a bigger pull request I would like to have a possibility to filter displayed files according to some patterns to prevent scrolling long page content and allow to focus on specific areas at once.\\
For example I want to focus first on **.js* files, next on **.spec.js* next on **.html* and so on. Filter should be done on frontend (no reload necessary) and should IMO hide completely files that doesn't meet the pattern.\\
Of course UX should take into consideration all aspects like:

* explicity marked filter-mode (some icon on the left side menu? some background color change?)
* no possibility to approve until filter active

I think a good place to place this filter input field might be next to _Files changed (NN)_ message.

Also I wanted to mention that the file view panels should be collapsible (regardless the file size) but I noticed something similar already reported: BCLOUD-7086
fields.summary: Ability to filter PR files list by using simple text input accepting regex, wildcards etc.

fields.description:
For a repository we're using I've created a simple push webook to an endpoint we control. However Bitbucket doesn't even send the requests.

I've went to he "Pipelines request logs" webhook and I can see a list of requests for repo:push, but they're all old, from 18+ hours ago. There have been commits and pushes, even new branches today, even 5 minute ago, yet they don't appear as events.

The custom webhook I created for repo pushes doesn't list any events. I clicked "Load new events", nothing. I've added other events, for example repo:update, still nothing.

The webhook is active.

PS: It's not obvious to me if this ticket is private, if someone from Atlassian confirms it is I will post the repo name & co in a comment (or just edit the ticket).
fields.summary: Bitbucket.org webhook not working at all - not sending requests
